awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research:   Research, Synthesis, and Knowledge Transfer in a Changing Arctic: Science Support for the Study of Environmental Arctic Change (SEARCH)
awd_abstract_narration:
The Arctic is undergoing dramatic, accelerating environmental change, resulting in impacts on local, regional and global scales. Improved understanding of the present and probable future state of the arctic environment is important for a wide range of stakeholders, including arctic residents, the private sector, agencies and decision-makers. To develop and convey this understanding to decision makers, an interdisciplinary research program is needed that engages with stakeholders to provide science-based answers to stakeholder questions, and the Study of Arctic Environmental Change (SEARCH) is well positioned to serve this function. This project will build a support structure to enable SEARCH to serve the needs of the scientific community and agencies. The new research coordination structure will coordinate science, exchange knowledge and tools between science and stakeholders, drive scientific syntheses, and connect scientists and stakeholders to answer questions about arctic change. The new structure will ensure that its activities have societal benefit, and foster two-way communication of research findings and information needs. Proposed activities include knowledge exchange workshops that will facilitate networking between stakeholders and scientists, and stakeholders will be included in other synthesis research activities, meetings and conferences. A set of activities focused on the theme "Arctic Futures 2050" will frame scientific findings in a way that can help decision-makers plan for the future. All of these activities will lead to development of research products that address societal priorities and can help inform policy. 

SEARCH will facilitate research in response to scientific priorities and stakeholder questions about complex arctic change. This project will improve understanding, advance prediction, and explore the consequences of changing arctic sea ice; document and improve understanding of how degradation of near-surface permafrost will affect arctic and global systems; and improve predictions of future land-ice loss and its impacts on sea level. An additional overarching goal will be to analyze societal and policy implications of these arctic environmental changes, and a set of activities will be undertaken to integrate findings across all the thematic goals. These goals will be achieved by facilitating research across disciplines, scales and among agencies; advancing scientific synthesis of data, model output and expert projections; creating networks of people and research groups that promote efficiencies and scientific discovery; developing tools useful to stakeholders and decision-makers; and enhancing research coordination.

por.por_cntn:
The Study of Environmental Arctic Change (SEARCH) effort managed under this award generated and synthesized research findings and promoted Arctic scientific discovery across disciplines and among agencies. The specific themes addressed in this phase of SEARCH were:

1. Improve Understanding, Advance Prediction, and Explore Consequences of Changing Arctic Sea Ice;

2. Document and Understand How Degradation of Near-Surface Permafrost Will Affect Arctic and Global Systems;

3. Improve Predictions of Future Land-ice Loss and Impacts on Sea Level; and

4. Analyze Societal and Policy Implications of Arctic Environmental Change.

Over the course of this collaborative, multi-organization grant, the Arctic Research Consortium of the US (ARCUS) provided project office support to the SEARCH program. ARCUS tasks under this grant included:

  • Strategic planning;
  • Project management, including milestone and timeline development and tracking;
  • Meeting, workshop, and conference plan­ning and implementation;
  • Organizational support for the SEARCH Science Steering Committee (SSC) and Action Teams;
  • Website development; and
  • Communications and outreach.

 ARCUS was instrumental in kicking off this phase of the SEARCH program, including developing the initial SEARCH structure, governance, terms of reference, hiring, and collaboration plans amongst the groups involved in SEARCH. Over the course of the award, ARCUS facilitated and supported regular SEARCH Science Steering Committee and Action Team meetings and activities.

A multitude of successful workshops were held on a variety of Arctic science topics, including the Greenland Ice Sheet/Ocean Observing System planning, Climate Change Science Communication, Methane, Permafrost, Arctic Futures 2050 Scenarios, and others. A large conference was held in 2019, the "Arctic Futures 2050 Conference", which gathered nearly 400 researchers, Indigenous knowledge holders, policy makers, and others to explore six questions:

-What do we know, and what do we need to know about the Arctic, and why does it matter?

-What challenges confront policy makers in the rapidly changing Arctic?

-What basic research is needed to inform responses to Arctic change?

-What applied research is needed to inform responses to change?

-What tools can facilitate informing policy making with science and Indigenous knowledge?

-What opportunities exist for partnerships between policy makers and scientists?

Summaries and products for all workshops and conferences were developed and made publicly available on ARCUS' SEARCH website, which received over 45,000 views per year.

ARCUS also facilitated or led discussions and meetings, and collaboratively produced several white papers and reports on recommendations from the research community to develop a coordinated Arctic Observing Network to better understand the changing Arctic.

As part of this grant, ARCUS also supported the development of SEARCH's "Arctic Answers" briefs, which were short, accessible summaries developed for decision makers on key questions about Arctic environmental change.

Outreach accomplishments included numerous presentations, town halls, newsletter articles, conference sessions, and a comprehensive SEARCH website to ensure all SEARCH outcomes and products were widely accessible.
